Assuming that you're using a POSIX shell (like ksh) you can let the 
shell =
do the work:

${parameter:+word}   If parameter is set and is nonnull, 
   =
                  substitute word; otherwise, substitute
                  =
   nothing.

which changes your command from:
	ant -Dtestfile=3D"$2" $1
to:=

	ant ${2:+ -Dtestfile=3D\"$2\"} $1

You might want to echo the command so =
the "other guys" can see how 
easy ant would be ;-)  I'm very novice when i=
t comes to ant, but 
quite an expert at shell scripting.

-Rob
